The only alternative was to purchase a card-attached sticker or opt for a store credit refund, which seemed rather impractical.Despite my attempts to contact the company three times to cancel my order immediately after purchase, the unlocking process remained unresolved. Regrettably, my requests for a refund were rejected on all three occasions, with the company insisting that a refund was impossible.Eventually, out of frustration, I reluctantly agreed to receive store credit as a refund, thinking it was better than receiving nothing at all, especially when the company was unwilling to return the money. However, this decision became a point of contention, with the company trying to persuade me to withdraw my negative review.It's crucial to remember that a review reflects the result of one's experience. I would advise anyone considering a purchase on this website to exercise caution and scrutinize every word in their refund policy, as it's clear that their claims of a money-back guarantee can't be trusted.

Review.Titre: Read the Refund Policy on a separate page before you order anything.
Review.Contenu: June 25, 2019 Update: well I finally received a refund, 30 days after I was initially refused a refund. I got the refund after the company responded to the review shown below. It's notable the company did the right thing after all, but I do struggle to give them 3 stars because technically the overall experience was a time waster and I wound up returning the phone they later claimed they unlocked. Since I only had the phone for a few days, it appears someone else bought it from AT&T and probably had AT&T unlock it. I truly never did get the phone unlocked from UnlockBoot as they were trying to claim with Trustpilot. Before using their service I recommend reading the fine print on the policy page if you want to know what may happen if they can't unlock your phone on the first go around. For the record I have screen captures of their web site and lack of proper policy display the day I made my purchase, and I have screen captures and the text log of their totally rude agent Stephan. So just be aware they provide a valuable service that probably works as advertised most of the time, however when they make a guarantee, note that it is conditional and if you get Stephan as your agent, don't expect him to be helpful or polite.******Original Review: Absolute ripoff. They do not post anywhere in the checkout process that if the process does not work that they won't refund any of your money. In fact their pages say they guarantee they can unlock the phone. They don't guarantee anything. And none of the checkout pages spell out the no refund policy. Within 15 minutes of purchase I asked for my money back and they refused. Then the agent Stephan sent me the emoji with one finger. At no time did I say anything improper to warrant such offensive behavior. This is absurd. I hope PayPal will refund my money and simply not pay these crooks! UPDATED... Stephan refused to refund my money and now I see he has reported this review as SPAM. Totally dishonest. And now I read further down the bad reviews and others call the service a scam and they even refunded other people. Or said they did and never refunded them. So why refund others? I was told it is a no refund policy. The dude is rude.******June 22, 2019 Update... the seller never unlocked my phone and never refunded my money despite the fact that they buried the refund policy and the page I was on said they "guarantee they could unlock my phone". I returned the phone to the seller, someone else has purchased it, and they are now trying to tell me the phone unlocked and I should remove my review. Let's go over this one more time... the agent Stephan sent me the one finger emoji in my chat with him merely because I pointed out their lack of proper display to their refund policy and instead guaranteed satisfaction written on the page. They are insisting I remove this review review and trying to bully me. This is unacceptable and they should be fined for such aggressive and irrefutable business practices. If it wasn't $10 I'd sue them but it's not worth the time. I am however reporting them to the FTC.
